gw.api.web.accounting

Class WriteOffFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.web.accounting.WriteOffFactory

  • public class WriteOffFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory for creating write-offs (both positive and negative) against various write-off targets

    • Method Detail

      • createChargePatternWriteOff

        public GrossWriteoff createChargePatternWriteOff(TAccountOwner targetOfWriteOff)
        Creates a ChargeGrossWriteoff against the given Account or Producer.
        Parameters:
        targetOfWriteOff - Must be an Account or a Producer for which the write-off will be created.
        Returns:
        a write-off instance for the given target

      • createInvoiceItemGrossWriteOff

        public ItemGrossWriteoff createInvoiceItemGrossWriteOff(WriteoffReason writeOffReason,
                                               InvoiceItem invoiceItem,
                                               @Nullable
                                               AgencyPaymentItem associatedPaymentItem)
        Creates an ItemGrossWriteoff against the given invoice item. Charge gross write-offs are used to write off the entire unsettled gross amount on a given invoice item. This will handle both oversettlement and undersettlement. Initializes the write-off with the unsettled gross amount on the invoice item. You can supply an optional associatedPaymentItem if you wish to link this write-off to an AgencyPaymentItem such that when the agency payment item is reversed, so is this write-off Note, this method only creates and sets up the write-off. The user will still need to call AbstractWriteOff.doWriteOffWithApproval() in order for the write-off to be executed.
        Parameters:
        writeOffReason - The reason for the write-off
        invoiceItem - The invoice item this write-off should target
        associatedPaymentItem - The optional associated agency payment item that should be linked to this write-off
        Returns:
        The unexecuted write-off

      • createChargeCommissionWriteOff

        public ChargeCommissionWriteoff createChargeCommissionWriteOff(ChargeCommission chargeCommission,
                                                      MonetaryAmount amount)
        Creates a ChargeCommissionWriteoff against the given charge commission. Charge commission write-offs are used to write off the reserve on a given charge commission, by the supplied amount. This will handle both positive and negative reserve, always bringing the reserve closer to zero, and creating a set of
        Parameters:
        chargeCommission - The charge commission this write-off should target
        amount - The amount of reserve that should be written off. This should be less than the difference between the current reserve and zero.
        Returns:
        The unexecuted write-off

      • createInvoiceItemCommissionWriteOff

        public ItemCommissionWriteoff createInvoiceItemCommissionWriteOff(ItemCommission itemCommission,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         AgencyPaymentItem associatedPaymentItem)
        Creates an ItemCommissionWriteoff against the given item commission. Item commission write-offs are used to write off the entire reserve on a given item commission. This will handle both positive and negative reserve, always bringing the reserve closer to zero, and creating a
        Parameters:
        itemCommission - The item commission this write-off should target
        associatedPaymentItem - The optional associated agency payment item that should be linked to this write-off
        Returns:
        The unexecuted write-off

      • createProducerWriteOff

        public ProdWriteoffContainer createProducerWriteOff(Producer producer)
        Creates a ProdWriteoffContainer against the given producer. Producer write-offs are used to write off the unapplied amount on a given producer. It can only be used to increase the amount in the producer's unapplied (credit only). Note, this method only creates and sets up the write-off. The user will still need to call AbstractWriteOff.doWriteOffWithApproval() in order for the write-off to be executed.
        Parameters:
        producer - The producer who's unapplied this write-off should target.
        Returns:
        The unexecuted write-off

      • createProducerNegativeWriteOff

        public ProdNegativeWriteoff createProducerNegativeWriteOff(Producer producer)
        Creates a ProdNegativeWriteoff against the given producer. Negative producer write-offs are used to write off the unapplied amount on a given producer, but unlike the regular producer write-off, this time in the carrier's favor. Negative producer write-offs can only be used to decrease the amount in the producer's unapplied (debit only). Note, this method only creates and sets up the write-off. The user will still need to call AbstractWriteOff.doWriteOffWithApproval() in order for the write-off to be executed.
        Parameters:
        producer - The producer who's unapplied this write-off should target.
        Returns:
        The unexecuted write-off

      • createAccountNegativeWriteOff

        public AcctNegativeWriteoff createAccountNegativeWriteOff(Account account)
        Creates a AcctNegativeWriteoff against the given account. Negative account write-offs are used to write off the unapplied amount on a given account in the carrier's favor. Negative account write-offs can only be used to decrease the amount in the account's unapplied (debit only). Note, this method only creates and sets up the write-off. The user will still need to call AbstractWriteOff.doWriteOffWithApproval() in order for the write-off to be executed.
        Parameters:
        account - The account who's unapplied this write-off should target.
        Returns:
        The unexecuted write-off
